title: Did Eddie Van Halen run out of ideas? Why is he so quiet? - Quora

response.answer_text: It’s hard to say if he’s run out of ideas or not. He has consistently stated that he has a lot of ideas that he’s holding onto until… well, that’s the question, isn’t it? Here’s the thing. I don’t think he has any real, practical idea what to do with whatever he does. As I discussed in Neil Sarver's answer to Is Eddie van Halen's guitar work the main appeal of Van Halen?, Eddie Van Halen needs a frame to put around his playing.  At this point, the clear “party” frame that David Lee Roth have him doesn’t seem to interest in. I know the popular explanation for A Different Kind of Truth being mostly material was that the band couldn’t put up with each other. I’m not arguing that’s not somewhat true, but I also think Eddie is no longer that interested in creating within that frame. I also don’t think that he ever settled into a clear frame with Sammy Hagar or Gary Cherone to go back to, if he were interested. So, he’s left with the question is what he would do, and I think he doesn’t know what that would be at this point, and I don’t think with all of the success he’s already enjoyed he’s personally driven to figure it out. I’m not saying he couldn’t stumble into something in the future, but I don’t think he feels he has something to prove. He can do whatever music he does for his own purposes. He can proudly watch as Wolfgang Van Halen works on his solo album. I think he’s mostly ok with that.

I don’t know Eddie personally but if I had to make an educated guess, it’s not that Eddie has run out of ideas as much as he’s run out of people he can work with. His personality clashes with lead singers is legendary and he and Alex have kind of become notoriously difficult to work with. Add to that Van Halen’s main audience isn’t interested in seeing them with yet another front man which means that Ed and Al mend fences with Sammy, tolerate Dave or try to push another singer into their fans (which again, there just doesn’t seem to be a market for). The last album and tour with Dave was good but both Eddie and Dave admitted they really don’t enjoy each other’s company and don’t really have much in common anymore. The last tour they did with Sammy had both parties taking separate planes, staying in different hotels, etc. The only time they saw each other was on stage. So I’d count on not hearing much from Van Halen unless they need the money or want to promote something.

You really have to know a person intimately to be able to say why they may have ceased to present creative output. And this quietness could be anything from a creative wit dulled from years of partying to a welcome time in a rock star’s life of not having to work on songs all the time, of not having to get ready for the next world tour, not having to argue with bandmates and stakeholders over every last note. It’s not necessarily a bad thing. Nor do we we know, whether Mr. van Halen might not be privately awash in a prolific deluge of ideas without precedent yet simply disinclined to share for whatever reason. That being said, it’s equally possible that we’ve heard the last good work from one of the 20th century’s most astounding musical minds.

Most likely because he’s a one trick pony. No real talent other being able to hit a lot of nonsense notes on a loud guitar in rapid fashion. That along with the fact that he may have been born with fetal alcohol syndrome. The guy has no upper lip,, and that flat nose. A classic sign of FAS.
